channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: For Some Wounded in Ukraine War, Surgery Helps Rebuild a Sense of Self
item.description: Surgeons have made significant strides in tending to the war’s wounded, particularly through the use of 3-D printing, creating patient-specific implan...

item.title: With Sanctions Looming, Trump’s Envoy to Russia Meets With Putin
item.description: The envoy, Steve Witkoff, is making his fifth visit this year. He has managed to secure some prisoner exchanges but made no clear progress so far on e...

item.title: Gen Z dropouts could be your future boss: 20-something year olds without degrees are leading the charge in side gigs
item.description: The Jeff Bezos and Elon Musk’s of tomorrow could be Gen Z dropouts—new research shows they’re most likely to be working on their own side hustle outsi...

item.title: Why the B.L.S. Regularly Revises Jobs Data
item.description: President Trump fired the head of the Bureau of Labor Statistics last week and described a jobs report that included a big downward revision as “rigge...

item.title: WM CEO Jim Fish on sustainability in the waste, recycling, and landfill industry
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Trump’s threatened 40% tariff on ‘transshipped’ goods tries to target China and its manufacturing strength
item.description: Analysts say Washington likely wants to develop supply chains that are less reliant on China.

item.title: Trump says Japan to import Ford’s huge F-150 pickup trucks
item.description: Confusion hangs over details of a trade deal struck between the U.S. and Japan, sparking concern over its enforcement, particularly regarding cars.

item.title: Statue of French General Accused of Torture Divides His Hometown
item.description: An effort to have a statue of Marcel Bigeard removed has reignited the debate over how the colonial past should be remembered.
